Comments_List: I learned a lot about tensors, collisions, basic proofs, rotating systems, soring systems, etc.
how to quantify and describe how things are oriented in space and how they move. Basically an extension of physics with more math.
The course was taught very well, with lots of examples, office hours, and review. The MATLAB problems, while sometimes tedious, were insightful.

The course did a good job of not feeling too overwhelming even though we had such a short period to learn all of the material. The TA was great and always there to offer help when we needed it. Sometimes it was hard to see how the things we were learning would be useful in real life.
Yes  it's a good applied math elective and one of the better mechanical engineering courses I have taken.
